summary: The Eliminating Leftover Expenses for Campaigns from Taxpayers (ELECT) Act of 2025 aims to reduce federal spending and the deficit by ending taxpayer financing of Presidential election campaigns. It amends the Internal Revenue Code to eliminate the designation of income tax payments for this purpose after December 31, 2024. Furthermore, it terminates the Presidential election campaign fund and account, transferring remaining funds to the general fund of the Treasury to be used for deficit reduction.
